ref_item.description: Stanford Exercise Questionnaire; min score = 0, max score = 180; higher scores = better outcome

pred_item.measure: Physical activity measured by Stanford 7-Day Physical Activity Recall Questionnaire (PAR)
pred_item.description: Self-reported time spent engaged in stretching/strengthening activities and aerobic activities, assessed using the Stanford 7-Day Physical Activity Recall Questionnaire. Scores range from 0-180 for stretching/strengthening and 0-180 for aerobic activity.

ref_item.description: steps per day measured by wearable step tracker at 12 weeks

pred_item.measure: Physical activity measured by number of steps recorded using Fitbit activity tracker
pred_item.description: Weekly step count recorded by Fitbit activity tracker worn by participants throughout the 12-week study period

ref_item.description: measured by opioid morphine mg equivalents used each day (MED)

pred_item.description: Opioid prescriptions extracted from electronic health record (formulation, dose, and quantity) for the previous 24 hours. Measured in morphine milligram equivalents (MME) for opioids and milligrams (mg) for buprenorphine.

ref_item.description: measured by interference with walking on PROMIS (Patient-reported Outcomes Measurement Information System) pain interference tool, which is a 6-item self-report survey; each item is scored from 1 (not at all) to 5 (very much), thus scores ranged from 6 to 30, with higher score indicating more pain interference.

pred_item.measure: Pain-related physical function measured by Pain Outcomes Questionnaire
pred_item.description: Degree to which chronic pain interfered with walking and completing activities of daily living, affected feelings of vitality, contributed to negative affect, and elicited fears of injury or re-injury. Each domain measured on a scale of 0 (not at all) to 10 (all the time).

ref_item.description: measured by pain severity on PROMIS (Patient-reported Outcomes Measurement Information System) pain severity tool, which is a 3-item self-report survey; each item is scored from 1 (no pain at all) to 5 (very severity), thus scores ranged from 3 to 15, with higher score indicating more severe pain.

pred_item.measure: Chronic pain severity measured by Pain Outcomes Questionnaire
pred_item.description: Participants rated the severity of their chronic pain on a scale of 0 (no pain at all) to 10 (worst possible pain)
